intro: Zeravschania pauciradiata, commonly known as the Kachin rose, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Myanmar. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a hairy texture, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest in botanical research.
